With tools like big data, artificial intelligence, or machine learning, you can obtain valuable data and insights to improve the well-being, health, and engagement of your workers. As a result, you can reduce absenteeism, turnover, and associated costs.

docs-intro.p1: Stay is an innovative system that allows organizations to efficiently and securely manage employee attendance. Developed with Laravel Jetstream, a robust and flexible platform offering authentication, authorization, team management, and other essential features, Stay facilitates the registration of employee entries and exits, as well as the tracking of working hours, absences, and leaves.
docs-intro.p2: Furthermore, Stay includes a statistical analysis module that enables valuable insights into organization performance, productivity, and work environment, generating automatic and personalized reports. With Stay, organizations can optimize their human resources, improve internal communication, and foster a culture of commitment and responsibility.

item-1-1.p1-1: Stay is optimized to function as a subdomain application and can run correctly on any server under a subdomain. A relatively recent server such as Dell G5 55XX, HP DL3XX G5, or IBM M2 with SSD or NVME storage is recommended.
item-1-1.p2-1: Any VPS with a minimum of 1GB of RAM and 1 core is sufficient, though SSD storage is recommended.
item-1-1.p3-1: The server must have internet access, and it is recommended to run it as a regular web application on a private subdomain of the organization.
item-1-1.p1-2: Scan points require minimal computing power, and the camera does not need to be overly complex. An Intel n3350 or even lower with 2GB of RAM should suffice. It is recommended to run some RHEL or Debian distribution.

aspects.heading: Features
aspects.section-intro: Below are some main features of Stay in general.

item-1-3.heading: Statistics
item-1-3.description: The current statistics are explained below.
item-1-3.note: Certain statistics may not work correctly until all users have given at least one attendance or departure, among other database requirements.

individual-stats.title: Present
individual-stats.description: The number of attendances given by the individual in question.

individual-stats.title: Late Attendances
individual-stats.description: The number of attendances given by the individual outside of regular working hours.

individual-stats.title: Absences
individual-stats.description: The number of absences of the individual in question.

individual-stats.title: Late and Absent Attendances
individual-stats.description: The number of attendances given by the individual outside of regular working hours and beyond the late limit.

individual-stats.title: Departures
individual-stats.description: The number of departures given by the individual in question.

division-stats.title: Average Absence
division-stats.description: Average absence per working day in the division.

division-stats.title: Weekly Average of Departures
division-stats.description: The weekly average of departures per division.

division-stats.title: Day with Most Absences
division-stats.description: The day with the highest average absences in the entire division.

division-stats.title: Individuals Near Limit
division-stats.description: Individuals close to the absence limit (25).

item-1-4.heading: Attendance and Departures
item-1-4.description: The current way of giving attendance or departing is through QR codes, as long as the current user's schedule using Stay is between the opening and closing hours of the working day, they can both enter and depart. Both supervisors and scan stations can scan the QR codes.

item-9-2.heading: Export
item-9-2.description: Stay allows various types of exports, and below are all the different types.

from-actions-tab.title: Divisions
from-actions-tab.description: Export entire divisions with the specified data in the division import section. You can select one or all existing divisions in the database.

from-actions-tab.title: Members
from-actions-tab.description: Export specific members, being able to export only user information or along with their departures and attendances.

from-actions-tab.title: Supervisors
from-actions-tab.description: Export user information for specific supervisors.

from-actions-tab.title: Attendance
from-actions-tab.description: Export the attendance of specific courses.

from-actions-tab.title: Departures
from-actions-tab.description: Export the departures of specific courses.

from-actions-tab.title: Holidays
from-actions-tab.description: Export existing holidays in the database.

general-database-tables.title: Members
general-database-tables.description: In the tables showing the members, you can export the basic information of the members of a certain division.

general-database-tables.title: Attendance
general-database-tables.description: In the tables showing the attendance of a certain division, you can export the information of these attendances, with the possibility of filtering by certain members.

general-database-tables.title: Departures
general-database-tables.description: In the tables showing the departures of a certain division, you can export the information of these departures, with the possibility of filtering by certain members.

item-9-3.heading: Roles
item-9-3.description: Primarily, roles are still users within the application, so they share certain things, such as being able to modify their own name, email, or password, while also requiring a second factor of authentication to function. This is to enhance system security.
item-9-3.roles-description: In Stay, there are several roles, each with different functionalities or different capabilities/privileges. These roles are:

roles.title: Members
roles.description: Members are all those who give or receive attendance. They can generate QR codes to give attendance or depart, in addition to basic abilities.

roles.title: Supervisor
roles.description: Supervisors have the ability to analyze and act on the teams or divisions assigned to them. They can scan member codes, view daily statistics, access the database of their assigned division, and export members, attendance, or departures of these members. They can also switch between divisions to view statistics given in the database preview.
roles.note: Supervisors cannot modify divisions, this is an action that only accountants can perform.

roles.title: Accountant
roles.description: Accountants are the main role in Stay and are granted (for now) only once when deploying the application for the first time. They are responsible for entering the divisions, members, supervisors, attendance, departures, holidays, scan stations, and other data. They can also modify all the information in the database, supervise all divisions, and export database information.

roles.title: Scan Station
roles.description: Scan stations are only responsible for scanning QR codes. They only display the camera in use and the last attendances (presentism).

note-1.title: Note
note-1.content: It is very important to respect the order and format. Importations that require several sheets with specific names need to have the non-obligatory sheets even if they are empty. Being empty will not import unnecessary elements, and the program will work.

note-2.title: Note
note-2.content: Remember to check all assigned IDs; they must not coincide with any current ID in the database, or Stay will end up modifying the database, which we do not want to happen.

errors.warning-content: If the error persists despite following the recommendations in this section, contact the email 'contact@stay.com.ar' with the error in the subject, and we will respond as soon as possible. Stay is an application in development, and occasional errors may occur.
errors.400-2: Check the URL to which the action is directing
errors.400-3: Check that you are not leaving any data without entering
errors.401-403-1: Check that you are authorized to perform the action
errors.401-403-2: Check that the session is properly started; otherwise, log out and log back into Stay
errors.404-1: The URL you are accessing does not exist
errors.404-2: Try going back to the home page (re-enter the application) and try again
errors.405-1: The method you are trying to use is not allowed for the specific URL
errors.405-2: Make sure you are using the correct method for the action
errors.409-1: You are sending too many requests at once
errors.500-1: Try to redo the action, as the error could have been temporary
errors.503-1: The server is not available for the moment, please try again later
